overview_of_class: Chemistry 210-B is the second course in a three-term sequence in organic chemistry. It covers the chemistry of the major oxygen- and nitrogen-containing functional groups, as well as the chemistry of aromatic compounds. Mechanism is emphasized in the study of these materials. The course includes a laboratory component which includes an introduction to basic organic laboratory techniques, as well as the preparation, purification and characterization of organic substances. Includes a Saturday laboratory (CHEM 230-B) from 9 a.m. to 1 p.m.
name: Organic Chemistry
title: SCS CHEM 210-B-65 Organic Chemistry
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Co-Requisite: Students must also register for Chemistry 230-B. Add both classes to the shopping cart and submit together for successful registration.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Chemistry 210-B is the second course in a three-term sequence in organic chemistry. It covers the chemistry of the major oxygen- and nitrogen-containing functional groups, as well as the chemistry of aromatic compounds. Mechanism is emphasized in the study of these materials. The course includes a laboratory component which includes an introduction to basic organic laboratory techniques, as well as the preparation, purification and characterization of organic substances. Includes a Saturday laboratory (CHEM 230-B) from 9 a.m. to 1 p.m.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Prerequisite: Grade of C- or better in CHEM 210-A.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value:
Class participation: Clicker Questions; in-class questions to which responses are submitted electronically.
2 Midterm Exams
Final Exam

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Organic Chemistry by L.G. Wade, 8th Edition.
Pearson Turning Technologies Model QT or NXT Response Card ("Clicker").

descriptions.name: Class Notes
descriptions.value: Must be taken concurrently with CHEM 230-B.

subject: CHEM
